column4: hi, does ubuntu provide full support for intel sandy bridge processor(i recently got core i3 dell vostro..), the battery back up seems to be quiet poor
what features of the i3 does it not seem to support? I have 11.04 running on an i3 2100T
the graphics is running without any visual effects (it has intel sandy bridge integrated graphics)
it came preloaded with ubuntu 10.10
newer versions always have expanded drivers and hardware support

lets suppose that i upgrade to 11.04, and the graphics issue is solved which i assume will most probably be the case bcoz i tried live fedora 15 cd it was working fine.. but what about the battery back up issue..
by 'battery back up' do you mean a UPS?
oh no he laptop battery backup i purchased dell vostro 1450.. and gives i think approx 2 hrs back up only
plz chk this link.. http://www.ubuntu.com/certification/hardware/201104-7889
by 'battery back up' do you mean a UPS?
no no ... latop battery
do you mean the battery is running down faster?
yes
its possible the cpu frequency scaling isnt working, so the cpu is running full blast all the time. Im trying to fix the same problem on a system I have
will this battery problem be there with windows 7 also??
i will hate to run windows.. on my laptop
no, Windows should already work
with full battery
did u check this link.. http://www.ubuntu.com/certification/hardware/201104-7889
read this:  http://www.ubuntugeek.com/howto-change-cpu-frequency-scaling-in-ubuntu.html
i read that but i think the cpu frequency seems to be ok although i will check again..
does 11.04 work??
it works for me - but Im not running on a laptop
